org.rdkit.knime.util

Class MultiSelectionListPanel

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JPanel
            • org.rdkit.knime.util.MultiSelectionListPanel
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible

    public class MultiSelectionListPanel
extends javax.swing.JPanel
    A multi-selection list combining a list, a scrollbar and two buttons to select all or none. With a "small GUI" option it is possible to reduce the list to a one-line non-editable text field that shows only the selected values. When clicking in the text field the list opens as a modal popup and allows the user to select the values.
    Author:
    Manuel Schwarze
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • MultiSelectionListPanel

        public MultiSelectionListPanel(java.lang.String[] arrItems,
                               int iVisibleRowCount,
                               boolean bSmallGui)
        Creates a new multi selection list panel for the specified elements. The list will have the visible height (rows) specified in the second parameter. If the third parameter is set the list will be hidden. Instead a text field with current selections is shown, which can be clicked to popup the list to make selections.
        Parameters:
        arrItems - Items to be added to the list.
        iVisibleRowCount - Number of visible rows in the list GUI element.
        bSmallGui - Set to true to show only a text field with selections that needs to be clicked to open a popup list.

      • MultiSelectionListPanel

        public MultiSelectionListPanel(javax.swing.DefaultListModel<java.lang.String> model,
                               int iVisibleRowCount,
                               boolean bSmallGui)
        Creates a new multi selection list panel for the specified elements. The list will have the visible height (rows) specified in the second parameter. If the third parameter is set the list will be hidden. Instead a text field with current selections is shown, which can be clicked to popup the list to make selections.
        Parameters:
        model - Model for the list. Must not be null.
        iVisibleRowCount - Number of visible rows in the list GUI element.
        bSmallGui - Set to true to show only a text field with selections that needs to be clicked to open a popup list.

    • Method Detail

      • getSorting

        public MultiSelectionListPanel.SortDirection getSorting()
        Returns the last applied sorting direction.
        Returns:
        Sorting direction.

      • sort

        public void sort()
        Applies a new sorting direction based on the last one. It basically toggles between ascending and descending.

      • setSorting

        public void setSorting(MultiSelectionListPanel.SortDirection sorting)
        Sets the new sorting direction based on the specified parameter.
        Parameters:
        sorting - Sorting direction to be applied.

      • getModel

        public javax.swing.DefaultListModel<java.lang.String> getModel()
        Returns the current list model.
        Returns:
        List model.

      • setValues

        public void setValues(java.lang.String[] arrItems)
        Sets the values for the list. The sorting direction is set back to None.
        Parameters:
        arrItems - Items to be shown in the list. Can be null.

      • setMultiLineTextValues

        public void setMultiLineTextValues(java.lang.String strMultiLineText,
                                   java.lang.String strSeparators)
        Sets the values for the list based on a passed in string that contains all values separated with the specified separator chars (can be more than one). The sorting direction is set back to None.
        Parameters:
        strMultiLineText - Values as string. Can be null.
        strSeparators - Separators used for splitting up the values. Can be null to used \n and , as default separators.

      • selectValues

        public void selectValues(java.lang.String[] arrSelections)
        Select the specified values in the list.
        Parameters:
        arrSelections - Selections to be applied. Not-contained items will be not added to the list. They are just ignored. Can be null to unselect everything.

      • getValues

        public java.lang.String[] getValues()
        Determines from the list all current values and returns them as array.
        Returns:
        List values.

      • getMultiLineTextValues

        public java.lang.String getMultiLineTextValues(java.lang.String strSeparator)
        Determines from the list all current values and returns them as one string that is separated by the specified separator.
        Parameters:
        strSeparator - Seperator to be used to concatenate the values. Can be null to use , as default.
        Returns:
        List items as concatenated string.

      • getSelections

        public java.lang.String[] getSelections()
        Determines from the list all selected values and returns them as array.
        Returns:
        Selected values.

      • updateSmallGui

        protected void updateSmallGui()
        Updates the small text field GUI component, if it exists, with the selections done in the popup list or by setting them.

      • createString

        protected java.lang.String createString(java.lang.String[] arrItems,
                                        java.lang.String strSeparator)
        Returns the specified items as one string that is separated by the specified separator.
        Parameters:
        arrItems - Items to be concatenated. Can be null.
        strSeparator - Separator to be used to concatenate the values. Must not be null.
        Returns:
        Concatenated string.

      • createDefaultListModel

        public static javax.swing.DefaultListModel<java.lang.String> createDefaultListModel(java.lang.String[] arrItems)
        Creates a default list model filled with the specified items.
        Parameters:
        arrItems - Items to be added to the list model. Can be null.
        Returns:
        Default list model containing the specified items. Never null.

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] argv)
        Just a test method to demonstrate how to use this list panel.
        Parameters:
        argv - Not used.
